course.subject: ECON
course.name: Financial Economics II: Corporate Finance
course.description: This course tracks the life and times of firms by examining crucial corporate policies including: investment policy (e.g., project valuation, mergers and acquisitions), financing policy (e.g., IPO), payout policy (e.g., pay dividends), and corporate governance (e.g., managerial compensation). These policies are the basis of all work in corporate finance and financial management.
course.prerequisites: ECON 5130 AND ECON 5140
